column2: This tech co. didn't get as many likes as it wanted after raising $16 billion for its 2012 IPO but it returned 105% within 2 years
column4: Filing for bankruptcy in 2009? No prob for this automaker, which raised $20.1 billion in a 2010 IPO
column6: A $731 million IPO in 2015 got this rhymingly named wearable fitness company in tremendous shape
column8: Drop the last 4 letters from the name of the app to get this company, the big IPO story of March 2017
column10: The one of the 3 main consumer credit reporting bureaus that does not begin with "E", it raised $664 million in 2015
